meanings.definition: To interrupt a conversation with a comment or remark.
meanings.sent1: During the meeting, Sarah interjects with her opinion on the new project.
meanings.sent2: It is rude to interject while someone else is speaking.
meanings.sent3: John always interjects with funny jokes at the most unexpected times.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter interjects into the serious discussion like a burst of sunshine.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise interjects into the peaceful atmosphere, startling everyone.

meanings.sent1: The designer interjects colorful patterns into the plain fabric.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to interject the key points into your presentation.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to interject a secret ingredient into the recipe.
meanings.sent4: His bold idea interjects a sense of creativity into the project.
meanings.sent5: The artist interjects emotion into every brushstroke, creating a masterpiece.
